attributes.action: Disallow Schools To Confiscate Mobile Phones
attributes.background: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate items such as mobile phones. Mobile Phone are necessary to a child's learning, it lets the student to enhance the internet, release stress, contacts friends for social support and let's parents and carers now where their child is and if they are ok.
attributes.additional_details: Yes, Phones can be a distraction meaning students must not use them in class but a teacher must not confiscate them. What are students suppose to do if they are in trouble walking home? What if they need to go to a friend's due to an emergency? What if the parent needs to contact the child but does not know where they are and who to ring?

attributes.action: Reform the law on incarcerating drug addicts, introducing harm reduction clinics
attributes.background: The 'Harm Reduction' drug policy used in Switzerland in the 1980's  has had a range of positive impacts on addicts, and should be used in the UK.Two-Thirds of the addicts who entered the harm-reduction clinics found full time jobs as they did not spend their time and money financing their addiction.
attributes.additional_details:
- http://vancouver.ca/people-programs/four-pillars-drug-strategy.aspx
 - https://www.globalcommissionondrugs.org/the-hardline-approach-to-drugs-must-end-by-richard-branson/
- http://www.smh.com.au/comment/swiss-recipe-for-dealing-with-drug-addiction-proves-a-success-20130622-2opcj.html

The benefits that addicts can receive from the harm reduction strategy hugely outweighs the 'positives' brought by the more traditional, hard-line policy that punishes and incarcerates addicts which inevitably worsens their addiction and leaves them stripped of opportunities when released.

attributes.action: Get Michael Gove to maintain farming subsidies after Brexit.
attributes.background: Under current EU legislation farmers in the UK receive 3 billion pounds year in subsidies mostly in basic payments which are based on per acre owned of land.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove the environment secretary has pledged post Brexit to maintain the basic payments for most farmers for a transition period only. He is in the meantime reviewing several options to cap the payments and introduce progressive reductions.

The petition is to maintain the payments to the farmers.

British Farming employs 3.8 million people and is a business worth 109 billion. The idea of the petition is to educate the public about the value British farming has on the country and ask for their support by signing a petition to lobby their MP’s to support continuing subsidies for British farmers.

attributes.action: Nationalise the 3rd party element of vehicle insurance to benefit young drivers.
attributes.background: My partner's daughter's insurance was £2000 per annum for any car before any accidents at the age of 18. She now has had an accident that wasn't her fault and the new premium will be £4000 per annum. She cannot use public transport to get to her job. This premium represents more than half her wages.
attributes.additional_details: Any alternative system exists in New Zealand and is quoted by Wikipedia as follows - "Within New Zealand, the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC) provides nationwide no-fault personal injury insurance.[9] Injuries involving motor vehicles operating on public roads are covered by the Motor Vehicle Account, for which premiums are collected through levies on petrol and through vehicle licensing fees."

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory 6 weeks Comunity Service for 18-year-olds
attributes.background: There are some 750,000 18-year-olds in the UK. Their service to our nation would not only be an invaluable help to our understaffed, overstretched national health and education services but would also reestablish the commitment and responsibility we, as individuals, feel towards our community.
attributes.additional_details: Our nation’s young adults are able to bring the energy, enthusiasm and hard work to revitalize our public service sectors. Driving ambulances, escorting elderly patients to and from medical procedures and helping out in the classroom (with the necessary background checks); these six weeks would provide not only an immense service to our country but also an ideological grounding for its citizens. The UK is experiencing a time of increasing social divide in which our people feel estranged from the nation as a whole. Working hands-on with members of our community would deepen our understanding of our society and revolutionize the role we feel we play in it. An elevated feeling of responsibly towards our society will prove imperative to its success.

attributes.action: Debate the protection of vulnerable people from excessive insurance renewals
attributes.background:
The government needs to protect elderly and vulnerable people who are unable to look for and change to more competitive deals with alternative insurance providers for home insurance.

Which may result in the elderly person and property not being insured as the excessive cost is prohibitive
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of a number of elderly persons receiving excessive home insurance renewal premiums which were five times market rate. This is due to the insurance company's understanding that the elderly could be without internet access or otherwise isolated and would find it difficult or indeed impossible to move to cheaper alternative providers - and therefore incumbent insurance companies inflate renewals and any subsequent offers as there is no independent oversight available.

attributes.action: Reduce preventable negligence cases within the NHS
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are being let down by avoidable errors made by the NHS. Errors such as failing to provide emergency care, mistakes in dispensing the correct drugs and dosages, misdiagnosis, delays in treatment, and incorrect treatment. This is harming patients and causing unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last decade, negligence claims against the NHS have quadrupled to an annual payout of £1.7 billion. This is set to double by 2021. This suggests a growing problem that isn't being dealt with effectively. Health leaders propose to address this issue by capping the amount of compensation that is paid out to victims. Yet this won't reduce the number of negligence cases. We need to invest more resources into identifying the root causes of the problem and in turn implementing a solution.

attributes.action: Law requiring food chains to show the calories on menus.
attributes.background:
All food-service chains with 20 or more locations must post the number of calories in the food and drink items they sell.
This law should be implemented as it allows the public to count the amount of calories they eat. It can also reduce the chances of obesity.

attributes.action: Publish clearer guidance about speed limits for Vans as they are currently wrong
attributes.background:
The Road Traffic Act 1988 section 185 , 1 (b) defines the majority of van's currently on the road as a "motor car".

So schedule 6 speed limits do not apply to the majority of Vans.

I believe your guidance on Car-derived vans and dual purpose vehicles portray's incorrect speed limits for van's
attributes.additional_details:
Please see important website information and other petitions

http://bentcop.boards.net/thread/160/petition-government-clarity-speed-limits

attributes.action: Instate a Queens day in honour of Queen Elizabeth the 2nd.
attributes.background: The Queen is a staple of Britain, I and many others believe she should have a bank holiday dedicated to her Highness.

attributes.action: Start a Parliamentary debate over funding of the UK's crumbling road network
attributes.background: The UK is the 9th richest country in the world by GDP however a recent survey of the standard of its road network placed it 27th behind such countries as Namibia and Ecuador. The problems represent chronic under investment in crucial infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Studies have shown patching up roads to be 10 times more expensive in the long run than resurfacing entire stretches.

Please sign this petition if you too have had enough and think it is time the funding of road maintenance was subject to a serious debate in Parliament in attempt to bring the road network of the UK to a standard where it is actually fit for purpose rather than the national embarrassment, safety hazard to road users and barrier to economic growth that it currently is.

attributes.action: Black Ancient History to be taught in schools. As a course, module, in all level
attributes.background: In school the only recollection of any study about Africa, was based upon African colonisation, and pro independence; this was fine, until I started to come across information about African Ancient History post university, by myself, with the help of the internet. I felt overwhelmed and shocked.
attributes.additional_details:
I did Politics and International Relations Degree.

Nevertheless missing African Ancient history is like missing a huge chunk of world history.

If the following is included in the educational system, it would be great. Information about.....

- Nubia



- Songhai

- Lost African Kings and Queens such  as: Nefertiti, Sheba, Hannibal

- Kemet

- Ashanti

- Moors (when blacks ruled Spain)

 -Benin Empire(1180-1897 CE) , Mali Empire (1235-1600 CE) , Ghana Empire (700-1240 CE)

+ more

attributes.action: Ban large boats from passing through swing bridges at peak times.
attributes.background:
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic
3. Pollution - Every car passing the route will be sat in the same spot with the engine running for a good 20-30 minutes
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why boats shouldn't be allowed to pass through swing bridges at peak times;
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic. Dying? Tough - a boat needs to deliver a few boxes of car parts
3. Pollution - pretty much every car that is on its way home from work will be sat in the same spot with the engine running (unless it's stop start) for a good 20-30 minutes

attributes.action: "PAMPER ON PRESCRIPTION" -  health professionals to prescribe holistic therapies
attributes.background: This idea could potentially save the NHS £millions.  As a sufferer from Mental Health issues I have often felt the need for relaxation to aid my stress levels, and have personal experience that even basic massage is the best relaxant and stress reliever ***(Please read 'more details' section)***
attributes.additional_details: The massage itself works wonders, but the talking that accompanies the treatment is also very therapeutic.  e.g. a simple hand massage.  To pay for these treatments can be relatively costly for me, but if I could access the therapies regularly, I would be able to cut down on expensive medication, thereby saving the NHS money.  I can advocate this idea as I know it works.

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: Redirect funds gained from taxing 'Legal Highs' to Safe Housing & Rehab Centres
attributes.background:
Formally Legal highs started out as a legal recreational drug, found in many shops in the UK and often seen in use in festivals. 
Fast forward 10 years and the now illegal  psychoactive substances leave addicts with side effects, paranoia, coma, seizures and death with no specialised support.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the new legislation ( The Psychoactive Substances Act May 2016)  ' legal high' was the title given to  substances sold that emulated illegal drugs such as cocaine,heroin, speed, cannabis. It could be found sold in shops/festivals/online. Since the Ban was enforced these psychoactive drugs have been forced underground and are now even more dangerous. I suggest that any taxes gathered from the years that the drug was 'legal ' should be redirected in specific rehab and homeless centres.

attributes.action: Ban the use of video interviews using computer analysis to select candidates
attributes.background: Many companies have began using video interviews in their application process. These interviews are reviewed by a computer and never seen by a person. The algorithms used cannot account for behavioural differences exhibited by people with disabilities and so, it removes them as viable candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Video interview algorithms are set up to analyses both verbal and non-verbal communication. The main problem with this system is that the characteristics which are deemed to be ‘good’ are generally characteristics which people with learning difficulties, such as ADHD or Aspergers will never display under the circumstances of a video interview. In an actual face to face interview, the interviewer can understand and account for the difference in communication while an algorithm cannot.

attributes.action: Make sadism a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition asks the government to create a new criminal offence called
 'Causing suffering for a sadistic cause'.
The act will cover all cases in which somebody deliberately physically or mentally harms a person in an unprovoked attack and then gets pleasure from their reaction/ suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
The crime will have a maximum sentence of 5 years imprisonment and will be classed in 3 rungs.

Rung A - max 5 years custody
Performing mental torture or depraved acts for a sadistic cause.

Rung B - max 2 years custody
Harming someone's mental or physical health in order to gain pleasure.

Rung C - max 6 months custody
Getting pleasure from the reaction or suffering of a person who has been mentally or physically harmed.

attributes.action: Stop Dartford toll fees.
attributes.background: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

attributes.action:
Higher Minimum Wage for anti-social hours
(11pm-6am).
attributes.background: Sometimes an employer will pay staff who work anti-social hours a higher wage than those who work normal hours, but not very often; especially in the bar industy. Working anti-social hours can put a strain on the health and limits people's chances to join in on family and social life.
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately, there is no legal entitlement to increased pay for working anti-social hours, and I think this should change! Thanks

attributes.action: UK referendum on the free movement of people from European Union countries.
attributes.background:
A referendum on free movement of people from the European Union is essential. 
 Let the country decide who can come here, with a simple yes or no referendum.

attributes.action: Put a tax on fish so fish can flourish more in the ocean.
attributes.background: Over fishing is declining fishes numbers so if there were a tax on buying them fishing would decline and the government would get more money.

attributes.action: Require all UK betting shops to have security screens to protect staff.
attributes.background: The Gambling Commission recommends such screens but it is down to the Local Authority who issue licences whether or not they are needed. It should be a legal requirement for all Betting Shops to have safety screens. All Betting Shops should have them, like banks and Post Offices do.

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher maths papers and make one whole paper for everyone.
attributes.background: As everyone knows, there is higher and foundation maths. Foundation is for those who aren't as able at Maths but sometimes people are wrongly placed there. Make one whole paper for everyone, you never know what people could achieve. It would be fair to everyone if we all do the higher paper.
attributes.additional_details: The highest grade you can get for Foundation maths is C and it's known that its much easier to get a C in higher. Most people in foundation maths could easily get a 8 or a 9 (A's). The paper should be equal.

attributes.action: Remove  the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Demonstrate how more disabled people in the workforce has impacted productivity.
attributes.background: On the 6/12/17, whilst giving evidence to the commons Treasury Select committee, Phillip Hammond stated that "It is almost certainly the case that...very high levels of engagement in the workforce, for example of disabled people...may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements.
attributes.additional_details:
For a full transcript, follow the link

http://data.parliament.uk/writtenevidence/committeeevidence.svc/evidencedocument/treasury-committee/budget-autumn-2017/oral/75188.html

attributes.action: Make sure we get a Brexit Deal.
attributes.background: If Brexit didn't have a deal, it would be chaos for us. If we can't get a  deal, we're on our own, and we'll have to rely on other countries to give us power and maybe being the end of the UK altogether. So there must be a Brexit deal, or we're in anarchy.

attributes.action: Remove defensive architecture to help homeless people sleep safely
attributes.background: We undersign our HM Government to make it illegal for businesses and local communities to have defensive architecture on their buildings and benches. This is so that homeless people can have somewhere to sleep safely at night, without being harmed

attributes.action: Start a voluntary emigration programme for people who want to leave the UK.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of living in a small country with an ever increasing population and lack of government investment in jobs, housing, opportunities, transport, healthcare and poor standard of living.
attributes.additional_details:
You would be paid up to £100,000 by the Government to give up your British citizenship, if you’re entitled to another citizenship, in exchange for leaving the UK to settle elsewhere.

 

A contract can be signed, so that if someone changes their mind they will be liable to pay back the sum of money, if they want to gain back their citizenship. They will also not be able to join the scheme again.

attributes.action: Extend gender pay gap reporting rules to cover ethnicity pay gap
attributes.background: In April 2017, the government put into law a practice where employers with 250 or more employees must publish and report specific figures about their gender pay gap. We the undersigned call on the government to extend these reporting rules to ethnicity pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
Several companies and institutions have voluntarily published ethnicity pay gap data, which suggests ethnicity pay gap is as much of a problem as gender pay gap.

Tackling ethnicity pay gap is a national issue, and by making reporting on them mandatory, will, as with requirements to report gender pay gap, provide focus and momentum to enable positive change.

attributes.action: Introduce a standardised 'no added sugar' label
attributes.background: Being in the situation of needing to make lifestyle changes and cutting down on sugar, it turned out to be a lot more difficult to find food and drinks without added sugar than expected. Most processed food contains added sugar, not just the obvious sweets, cake and fizzy drinks!
attributes.additional_details: The red, amber and green food labelling has made it easier to identify healthier food and drinks but added sugar can still only be identified by going through the list of ingredients. In a time of increasing numbers of diabetes, obesity, cancer and other conditions a healthy lifestyle should be made easy. Natural sugar is still sugar but the way healthier option as it comes combined with nutrients.

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: The abolition of Audit total exemption for small private limited companies.
attributes.background: This provision is being severely abused by many claiming that their retained annual profit is around £200 - £2,000, totally unrealistic, and is costing the Treasury and the NHS billions of pounds in loss revenue and, above all, nothing is done about it.

attributes.action: Require Schools in England to teach & sing the National Anthem once a week
attributes.background: Only 35% of the UK are proud to be British says a recent poll, this is a giant drop from 10 years ago! Why? The UK with England at it's heart invented the most popular sports. Have legends in Music, Arts, Science, Finance.. Team GB came 2nd at the Olympics!! So let's help regrow the National pride!!
attributes.additional_details: The USA, France and many countries sing their Anthem weekly in schools. Why do we not? We have so much to be proud of. From Yorkshire Puddings to Julie Dench, Mo Farah to Harry Potter. Whether it's Music, Arts, Sports, Commerce or any other possible area England are up there and dominating. Patriotism is falling rapidly, we need to help regrow the passion and allow our children to be taught the Anthem in Schools and to be proud like they should be of the great Country which they are living in.

attributes.action: Legally binding target to give men and women equal life expectancy.
attributes.background: End the worst gender inequality of them all - refocus health resources to give men and women equal life expectancy. The ONS states that the average life expectancy is 79 years for men and 83 years for women. This is a shocking discrimination against men, in the most fundamental way - life itself.
attributes.additional_details: The government should re-direct NHS resources to close the 4-year gap. No child should be born to a shorter life simply by being born male. Medical opinion is that there is no basic reason why women should live longer than men - so resources in research, treatment, health education etc. should be focused on men's health until the gap is closed.

attributes.action: 5 year driving ban for speads in excess of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.background: A driver who speeds excessively is aware of their actions. Therefore an immediate ban of 5years should be given to those driving in excess  of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are killed each year by speeding drivers. If those drivers were told if they speed more than 10mph over the specified limit they would be banned from driving for 5 years. We would have a lot of people asking themselves is it rely worth the risk of 5 year  instant ban.

attributes.action: Reinstate Part 2 of the Leveson Inquiry
attributes.background: The Government has cancelled the second part of the Leveson Inquiry into the scale of potentially unlawful behaviour by the Press and Police during the phone hacking scandal.
attributes.additional_details: The public deserves to know of any collaboration involved and any identified offenders should be brought to justice.

attributes.action: Make it an offense for essay writing services to advertise to under 16's
attributes.background: In the same way that gambling, alcohol and cigarettes are prohibited from advertising to minors, I suggest similar measures be applied to companies like UK Essays and other Essay Mills in order to protect minors from being unduly influenced by manipulative marketing practices.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Essays Website:
https://www.ukessays.com/services/essay-writing-service.php
Facebook Ad:
https://www.facebook.com/UKEssays/posts/10159836527715151
Twitter Ad:
https://twitter.com/UKEssays/status/970984231051636736

attributes.action: Start a British Foreign Legion.
attributes.background: Many British Army applicants are turned away due to their history of mental illness, certain complications such as having had a detached retina and also those with a criminal background. However The French Foreign legion could accept these failed applicants and they often prove to be great recruits.
attributes.additional_details:
So I ask that a British Foreign Legion is formed so Patriots of this country who were rejected by the British Army can serve their country, as I believe it is wrong that many patriots like my self are not given this opportunity, due to their pasts.
Just like the French Foreign legion, people who want to come to this country to make a better life for themselves could do so by serving five years in the British Foreign legion. After that time is served they can be granted British citizenship.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds take their CBT once they reach their final school year
attributes.background: When you're 16, you can take your cbt, ride a motorcycle, buy energy drinks, and get a job, however a 15 year old in the same school year can’t do any of these things. How come you're mature enough to be in the same school year, but not to have any of the perks?
attributes.additional_details: I found it especially frustrating, having a birthday in August, I had to see teenagers, who were in the same school year and learning the same as me ride motorbikes, and get jobs, while I was stuck in a village with no transport, a friend of mine in the same school year had a motorbike and had no issue, for instance, I could have been doing motorvehicle as an apprenticeship, but not be able to get a licence until after someone who’s never driven before, even though their the same year

attributes.action: Have a second referendum on leaving the EU
attributes.background: When the people voted to leave the EU on 26th June 2016 there was no proper debate or understanding about the implications of a decision to leave, either by the people or the government. Now the issues are clearer it is a moral and political duty to put it to the people again.
attributes.additional_details: The 2016 referendum appears to have been initiated in order to try and unite the Tory party. The issue of whether we are in the EU or not is so important it must be above party politics. Brexit must only be implemented after a fully informed electorate have been given the opportunity to confirm this is their choice.

attributes.action: Hold a Northern Ireland referendum on whether to Remain in the EU Customs Union
attributes.background: Northern Ireland voted by a significant majority to Remain in the EU and will be one of the regions most significantly affected by withdrawal. As Sinn Fein do not take up their seats in Parliament, it would be good to go directly to the NI electorate for their views on this proposal.

attributes.action: Privatise the NHS.
attributes.background: The privatisation of the NHS would mean taxes could be cut immensely or go to other areas. The privatisation would save money for the people as it will create more competition in the private market forcing lower prices for the competitive advantage of having cheaper care for the people.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS costs the average person £5,000 per year in taxes; the average person goes to the doctor's 4 times per year. If this was privatised then you would pay roughly £50 per visit, which is £200 per year. (This is based off American prices converted to pounds.) That is a lot of money to be saved per person. This extra money could grant lower taxes or more money going to other areas.

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: Charge a set £5 fee for every use of the NHS (i.e. GPs, ambulance or hospital)
attributes.background: Although we pay a contribution toward the NHS from our wages I feel there should also be a set fee.  We pay for home and motor insurance that we may never use, and when we do we pay an excess.  I feel the NHS should be no different.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is a great service, but society has changed considerably in the 70 years since its inception and the way the NHS is funded should be changed to reflect this.

attributes.action: A call for Highways England to make more sections of the M5 a smart motorway
attributes.background: Somerset Chamber of Commerce has long campaigned for better road infrastructure. The M5 is one of two main arterial routes into the South West. Frequently, the M5 between Gloucester and Exeter is affected by either full or partial closures affecting productivity, lost opportunity and serious injury.
attributes.additional_details: Following a freedom of information request to Highways England, it was confirmed that from 01/09/15 to 01/09/16 there were 16,934 incidents recorded on the M5 between Exeter & Gloucester, of which 3,547 resulted in full or partial closure, equating to an average of 10 accidents per day. The smart M42 motorway has resulted in no fatalities, reduced injury accidents by over 50%, and journey reliability improving by 22% since 2006, delivering major socio-economic benefits which could be replicated.

attributes.action: Introduce a separate, higher minimum wage for temporary workers and agency staff
attributes.background:
This petition is to help address the issue of unstable employment in our economy and to help promote the concerns about zero hour and temporary contracts. 
If temporary workers were given a higher minimum wage then this could encourage employers to offer permanent contracts and reduce exploitation.

attributes.action: Make PIP awards subject to a letter from a persons medical team only.
attributes.background: PIP awards are currently subject to an assessment with a healthcare representative. These people are unaware of the majority of medical conditions presented to them. I propose that a person applying for PIP, should be awarded this based on a report produced by their medical team looking after them.

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: I believe that every adult in the UK should pay £10 a month to the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been admitted into hospital twice in 5 years for 2 major life changing operations. I noticed how loving and caring the porters, nurses, doctors and surgeons all were. I was very shocked to see that they work 12+ hours a day, clean, cook, pay for parking and bring their own food.
attributes.additional_details: I would rather spend my £13.12 (which I have to pay every month for my BBC TV LICENCE) on the NHS. It should be compulsory!
